intro: Tetratheca aculeata, commonly known as the prickly tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive, small, yellow flowers. The plant has woody stems and produces small, oval-shaped fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a notable species in its native habitat.
